alert.note: Alert for Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 10:21AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Poweshiek and Tama Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 1020 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Tama, or 8 miles southeast of Toledo, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail and additional heavy rainfall of one to two inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Poweshiek and Tama Counties, including the following locations... Tf Clark State Park, Hartwick, Grinnell Regional Airport, Malcom, Elberon, Montour, Garwin, Victor, Toledo Municipal Airport and Holiday Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
